channel.title: Mac IP blocker
channel.description:
Can anyone recommend free downloadable ip blocking software?
Thanks! :D

item.title: Mac IP blocker
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

Moparisthebest:

However, be careful. Because last time I tested that on windows XP and firefox (maybe 1.5 at the time). Firefox did not send the proxy settings to Java, but IE6 and IE7 did, it is the one thing I know of where IE did better than firefox…

IE also does not have such a blatant memory leak.

Opera has turned me into a Firefox hate machine.

Read full topic

item.title: Mac IP blocker
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“bowserjr2, post:11, topic:181114”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=242504.msg2052084#msg2052084 date=1202968873]

Not to be stupid, but does this (HotSpotShield) redirect my IP for, say, Jagex?

Unless it is a socks5 proxy, then no. Even if you find a socks5 proxy you need to configure your browser and java to go through it.
[/quote]
Java’s proxy settings is set to “Use browser settnings” at default, and if not a good tut can you find here: http://www.java.com/en/download/help/5000020600.xml

So you only need to fix it on your browser, and if you really don’t want to be detected, don’t use your own web to things that you don’t want other to know that you are doing.[/quote]

However, be careful. Because last time I tested that on windows XP and firefox (maybe 1.5 at the time). Firefox did not send the proxy settings to Java, but IE6 and IE7 did, it is the one thing I know of where IE did better than firefox…

Read full topic

item.title: Mac IP blocker
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:10, topic:181114”][quote author=MAST3R PK3R link=topic=242504.msg2051877#msg2051877 date=1202961676]
Not to be stupid, but does this (HotSpotShield) redirect my IP for, say, Jagex?
[/quote]

Unless it is a socks5 proxy, then no. Even if you find a socks5 proxy you need to configure your browser and java to go through it.[/quote]
Java’s proxy settings is set to “Use browser settnings” at default, and if not a good tut can you find here: http://www.java.com/en/download/help/5000020600.xml

So you only need to fix it on your browser, and if you really don’t want to be detected, don’t use your own web to things that you don’t want other to know that you are doing.

Read full topic

item.title: Mac IP blocker
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

MAST3R PK3R:

Not to be stupid, but does this (HotSpotShield) redirect my IP for, say, Jagex?

Unless it is a socks5 proxy, then no. Even if you find a socks5 proxy you need to configure your browser and java to go through it.

Read full topic

item.title: Mac IP blocker
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

Moparisthebest:

You want a program to hide your IP address from websites? That isn’t possible, since when you request information you have to give them an IP to send it back to. You could use a proxy, but it still won’t be anonymous totally.

Don’t even Anonymous + Elite proxy?
But i have used http://hotspotshield.com and it look like it use Highly Anonymous proxy.

Read full topic
